list_definition.mean_english: xảy ra đồng thời, đồng bộ hóa
list_definition.definition: to (cause to) happen at the same time, go at the same speed etc, as something else

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: In the film, the movements of the actors’ lips did not synchronize with the sounds of their words

list_ex_of_english: X-ray radiation pulse from the anode can be temporally synchronized w. r. t. the incident laser pulse as a reference.
The robot controller would send a status indication at the start of each trajectory, so that the trajectory and physiological data could be synchronized.
Responses were compiled into average histograms synchronized to each temporal cycle of the stimulus.
The times were synchronized before any measurements were taken within the plots.
The detection of atrial and ventricular septal defects with electrocardiographically synchronized magnetic resonance imaging.
Spontaneous periodic synchronized bursting during formation of mature patterns of connections in cortical cultures.
Grating noise was removed, using amplitude and phase information computed from a synchronized data record maintained for this purpose.
Mapping fusion and synchronized hyperedge replacement into logic programming.
